intro: Calatola microcarpa, commonly known as the small-fruited bellflower, is a member of the Campanulaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa. The plant features showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Calatola microcarpa thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
